titleproper.value: Guide to the Marina Urbach Collection on C Space Gallery <num>MSS.577</num>

creation.value: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace <date>2019-07-17T14:54:23</date>

unittitle.value: Marina Urbach Collection on C Space Gallery

abstract.value: Marina Urbach is New York City-based an artist and curator. This collection consists of materials collected by Urbach related to C Space gallery in New York City in the late 1970s. Materials include exhibition announcement cards and copies of a catalog for the 1976 "Style and Process" exhibition organized by Urbach. Of note is a exhibition announcement for the 1977 "Memory" exhibition at C Space organized by Marcia Tucker in cooperation with the New Museum.

p.value: Identification of item, date; Marina Urbach Collection on C Space; MSS 577; box number; folder number or item identifier; Fales Library and Special Collections, New York University.
Donated by Marina Urbach in April 2019; the accession number associated with this gift is 2019.037.
Marina Urbach is New York City-based an artist and curator who oversaw the C Space gallery. In 1976 she organized the exhibition "Style and Process" at the Fine Arts Building.

This collection consists of materials collected by curator and artist Marina Urbach related to C Space Gallery in New York City. Materials include exhibition announcement cards and copies of a catalog for the 1976 "Style and Process" exhibition organized by Urbach. Of note is a exhibition announcement for the 1977 "Memory" exhibition at C Space organized by Marcia Tucker in cooperation with the New Museum.

corpname.value: New Museum of Contemporary Art (New York, N.Y.)
